title: cudnn version found error, v7 files but got v5.1.10
body_html:
I got this two problem #2575 , #1637 .
And when I use conda install
conda install pytorch torchvision cuda80 -c soumith
the cudnn version is 6021, got by torch.backends.cudnn.version(), even though I got 7.0.3
So, I have to install from source.
And the install log says cuDnn version not supported.
note: #pragma message: CuDNN v5 found, but need at least CuDNN v6.

And in the install log, I get this:
-- Found cuDNN: v5.1.10 (include: /usr/local/cuda-8.0/include, library: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so)$

The cudnn.h in the include folder is v7.

ll /usr/local/cuda-8.0/include/cudnn*  # /usr/local/cuda-8.0/include/cudnn.h -> /usr/include/cudnn.h
ll /usr/include/cudnn.h  # /usr/include/cudnn.h -> /etc/alternatives/libcudnn
ll /etc/alternatives/libcudnn # /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/cudnn_v7.h

And the libcudnn.so is also v7.

ll /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so # /etc/alternatives/libcudnn_so*
ll /etc/alternatives/libcudnn_so* # /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7*
ll /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7* # /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.0.3*

So, where does the cudnn found file find cudnn v5.1.10?

I got this two problem  #2575 , #1637 .
And when I use conda install
conda install pytorch torchvision cuda80 -c soumith

The cudnn.h in the  include folder is v7.
ll /usr/local/cuda-8.0/include/cudnn*  # /usr/local/cuda-8.0/include/cudnn.h -> /usr/include/cudnn.h
ll /usr/include/cudnn.h  # /usr/include/cudnn.h -> /etc/alternatives/libcudnn

And the libcudnn.so is also v7.

ll /etc/alternatives/libcudnn_so* # /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7*

So, where does the cudnn found file find cudnn v5.1.10?
body:
I got this two problem  #2575 , #1637 .
And when I use conda install 
`conda install pytorch torchvision cuda80 -c soumith`
the cudnn version is `6021`, got by `torch.backends.cudnn.version()`, even though I got `7.0.3`
 So, I have to install from source.
And the install log says `cuDnn version not supported`. 
`note: #pragma message: CuDNN v5 found, but need at least CuDNN v6. `

And in the install log, I get this:
`-- Found cuDNN: v5.1.10  (include: /usr/local/cuda-8.0/include, library: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so)$`

The` cudnn.h` in the ` include` folder is v7.
```
ll /usr/local/cuda-8.0/include/cudnn*  # /usr/local/cuda-8.0/include/cudnn.h -> /usr/include/cudnn.h
ll /usr/include/cudnn.h  # /usr/include/cudnn.h -> /etc/alternatives/libcudnn
ll /etc/alternatives/libcudnn # /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/cudnn_v7.h
```
And the `libcudnn.so` is also v7.
```
ll /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so # /etc/alternatives/libcudnn_so*
ll /etc/alternatives/libcudnn_so* # /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7*
ll /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7* # /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.0.3*
```

So, where does the cudnn found file find cudnn v5.1.10?
